fields.headline: Live music booking now
fields.bodyText: Shoegazey noise-rockers A Place To Bury Strangers set their effects pedals to stun (12-17 Sep, tour begins Komedia, Brighton) ... Liars and Totally Enormous Extinct Dinosaurs have been added to the bill for the first John Peel Festival Of New Music (11-13 Oct, various venues, Norwich) ... Goth rockers Evanescence return to reclaim their pompish crown (5-9 Nov, tour begins Capital FM Arena, Nottingham) ... Elf-like harmonic folkie Euros Childs returns with more pop charms (31 Aug-8 Sep, tour begins County Sports Club, Bristol) ... Catch the visceral post-punk of Savages before they break big (on tour to 16 Sep) ... Post-hardcore's answer to the MC5 At The Drive-In play a one-off show (Brixton Academy, SW9, 28 Aug) ... Allo Darlin' continue their emotive indie pop rise (31 Aug-13 Sep, tour begins The Hop, Wakefield) ... Lastly, prepare for some krautrocky, Crazy Horse-style sonic psych jams from Brooklyn's Woods (1-5 Sep, tour begins The Blind Tiger, Brighton).
